snippet: The tax mix-up, affecting taxpayers in 37 states, is the first major problem to surface in an otherwise smooth second enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Nearly 800,000 Americans who enrolled in insurance policies through HealthCare.gov are sent wrong information on forms they need to complete their 2014 tax returns; mistake could cause hardship for lower-income Americans who are qualified for subsidized insurance.
lead_paragraph: The tax mix-up, affecting taxpayers in 37 states, is the first major problem to surface in an otherwise smooth second enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Tax Error in Health Act Has Impact on 800,000
headline.print_headline: Tax Error in Health Act Has Impact on 800,000

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
